alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 06 at 1:28PM EDT until August 06 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Pulaski County in south central Kentucky... North Central Wayne County in south central Kentucky... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 128 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Somerset, Science Hill, Burnside, Pulaski County Park, Nancy, Naomi, Frazer, Pointer, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Stab, Faubush, Bronston, Hogue, Elihu, Quinton, Mill Springs, General Burnside S.P., Tateville, Magnum and Cains Store. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
